poem:
Dartford Disturbance

In quiet Dartford dreams,
night's cold breath—
Nina's last whisper  
sinks in the morning paper.  
We speak names,  
hushed, fractured,
in the court's sterile light—
shadows wrestle silently
as humanity's heart falters.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man in court in Kent charged with murder and sexual offence A man has appeared in court charged with the murder of a woman and committing a sexual offence against her dead body. Ernestas Juska, 20, appeared at Sevenoaks magistrates court on Monday over the death of Nina Denisova, 39, and spoke only to confirm his name, address and date of birth. Police said they were were called to a property in Dartford, Kent, after". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
